## MultishiftBaseProps interface

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface MultishiftBaseProps<GItem = any> 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [getA11yStatusMessage](./multishift.multishiftbaseprops.geta11ystatusmessage.md) | <code>GetA11yStatusMessage</code> | This function is passed as props to a status component nested within and allows you to create your own assertive ARIA statuses.<!-- -->A default getA11yStatusMessage function is provided that will check <code>items.current.length</code> and return "No results." or if there are results but no item is highlighted, "resultCount results are available, use up and down arrow keys to navigate." If items are highlighted it will run <code>itemToString(highlightedItem)</code> and display the value of the <code>highlightedItem</code>. |
|  [getItemId](./multishift.multishiftbaseprops.getitemid.md) | <code>GetItemId&lt;GItem&gt;</code> | A unique id for the item which is used to compare between two items.<!-- -->This defaults to just returning the item directly which means items are identical when <code>item === item</code>.<!-- -->The primary use case is when items are objects and the equality check above is always false even for objects with the same values. In that case you can define the <code>getItemId</code> prop.
```ts
const items = [{value: 'A', id: 'a'}, {value: 'B', id: 'b'}];
const getItemId = (item: typeof items[0]) => item.id;

```
This is very useful when an item is selected. By default multishift will run a uniqueness check and use the function provided above to prevent duplication. |
|  [items](./multishift.multishiftbaseprops.items.md) | <code>GItem[]</code> | The list ot items which are visible in menu.<!-- -->This can be changed via filtering. |
|  [itemsToString](./multishift.multishiftbaseprops.itemstostring.md) | <code>ItemsToString&lt;GItem&gt;</code> | Takes a list of items and transforms them into a string.<!-- -->This defaults to a comma separated list of the values. |
|  [itemToString](./multishift.multishiftbaseprops.itemtostring.md) | <code>ItemToString&lt;GItem&gt;</code> |  |
|  [stateReducer](./multishift.multishiftbaseprops.statereducer.md) | <code>(changesAndState: MultishiftStateChangeset&lt;GItem&gt;, action: MultishiftRootActions&lt;GItem&gt;, props: MultishiftProps&lt;GItem&gt;) =&gt; MultishiftState&lt;GItem&gt;</code> | This function will be called each time multishift sets its internal state (or calls the onStateChange handler for controlled props). It allows you to modify the state change that will take place which can give you fine grained control over how the component interacts with user updates without having to use controlled Props. It gives you the current state and the state that will be set, and you return the state that you want to set. |
